[tags]: 
Why financial time series have perfect multicollinearity?

I have daily financial time series of stock returns (35 stocks) which I took the natural logarithm and subtracted the risk-free rate. However, I get the issue non-invertibility of the covariance matrix which makes the matrix singular. The determinant of the covariance-matrix is also zero. Inverting a covariance matrix of financial times have been done multiple times. What is the reason for this issue and is there a fix for this? Here is a small output of my data using R with dput : structure(c(-0.00320406968829613, -0.00940813201973583, 0.0314625112393164, -0.023476404315932, 0.025038556843715, 0.00105390714331188,
